pl.edu.agh.icsr.janet.util
Class Regions

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--pl.edu.agh.icsr.janet.util.Regions
public class Regions
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains various methods for manipulating array regions (such as sorting and searching). There are equivalents of appropriate array methods from class Arrays.

binarySearch

public static int binarySearch(ByteRegion a,
                               byte key)
Searches the specified region of bytes for the specified value using the binary search algorithm. The region must be sorted (as by the sort(pl.edu.agh.icsr.janet.util.ByteRegion) method) prior to making this call. If it is not sorted, the results are undefined. If the region contains multiple elements with the specified value, there is no guarantee which one will be found.

Parameters:
a - the region to be searched.
key - the value to be searched for.
Returns:
index of the search key, if it is contained in the region; otherwise, (-(insertion point) - 1). The insertion point is defined as the point at which the key would be inserted into the region: the index of the first element greater than the key, or region.length(), if all elements in the region are less than the specified key. Note that this guarantees that the return value will be >= 0 if and only if the key is found.
See Also:
sort(ByteRegion)

equals

public static boolean equals(BooleanRegion a,
                             BooleanRegion a2)
Returns true if the two specified regions of booleans are equal to one another. Two regions are considered equal if both regions contain the same number of elements, and all corresponding pairs of elements in the two regions are equal. In other words, two regions are equal if they contain the same elements in the same order. Also, two region references are considered equal if both are null.

Parameters:
a - one region to be tested for equality.
a2 - the other region to be tested for equality.
Returns:
true if the two regions are equal.

equals
